New Records: Sunil Chhetri retired as the fourth highest goal-scorer in international football
Key Match Events: India played out a goalless draw against Kuwait in their FIFA World Cup 2026 qualifier match
A mini-brawl between Edmund and a Kuwait international with Sultan Alenezi stepping in between the two players
A huge chance for Kuwait but Gurpreet was once again up to the task as he saved it brilliantly
A brilliant piece of skill from Rahim Ali as he danced past a couple of Kuwait defenders and produced a solid pass inside the box
Pre-Game Insights: The match holds special importance for head coach Igor Stimac
A win over Kuwait will take the team into the unchartered territory of being up against the best of Asia in at least 10 matches
Sunil Chhetri will hang his boots at the end of this match and would like to ensure that the team enters the final-18 stage of the World Cup qualifiers for the first time
Post-Match Reflections: The entire stadium is emotional as Sunil Chhetri says farewell to the crowd
It is an emotional moment for Indian football as Sunil Chhetri's career comes to an end
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a farewell for Sunil Chhetri, who retired from international football after the game
The match was played at the Salt Lake Stadium, Kolkata
India remain second in their group and will now need a win over Qatar in their next match to qualify for the next round
